title: How to Make Blueberry Lemonade

steps.headline: In a medium saucepan, combine the water and sugar on medium heat.
steps.description: Mix with a wooden spoon until the sugar dissolves.

steps.headline: Add the blueberries and bring the mixture to a boil.
Bring down the heat to a simmer and heat until the blueberries break down.
steps.description: Allow it to simmer for about 3-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Strain the blueberry mixture into a sieve.
Whisk the blueberry mixture, water, and lemon juice into a large pitcher.
Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.
Serve.
steps.description: Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and enjoy!

steps.headline: Blend the blueberries, lemon juice, mint, and sugar in a blender.
steps.description: Blend until the mixture is a dark purple color and is smooth, resembling a smoothie.

steps.headline: Over a bowl, strain out the blueberry mixture into a fine mesh strainer.
steps.description: Press down the liquid using a wooden spoon. Throw out the leftover pulp.

steps.headline: Pour the blueberry mixture in a large pitcher and add the water.
Stir the lemonade with a wooden spoon until well-combined.
Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.
Serve.
steps.description: Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and mint, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Boil the one cup of water and sugar in a pot over medium heat.
steps.description: Mix until the mixture is clear.

steps.headline: Shut off the stove and remove the mixture from heat.
Stir in the lemon juice and mix.
Add the cold water and ice into a large pitcher.
Pour in the lemon juice, strawberries, and blueberries.
Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.
Serve.
steps.description: Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and strawberries, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Basic Blueberry Lemonade In a medium saucepan, combine the water and sugar on medium heat. Mix with a wooden spoon until the sugar dissolves. Add the blueberries and bring the mixture to a boil.  Bring down the heat to a simmer and heat until the blueberries break down. Allow it to simmer for about 3-4 minutes. Strain the blueberry mixture into a sieve.  Whisk the blueberry mixture, water, and lemon juice into a large pitcher.  Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.  Serve. Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and enjoy! Blueberry Mint Lemonade Blend the blueberries, lemon juice, mint, and sugar in a blender. Blend until the mixture is a dark purple color and is smooth, resembling a smoothie. Over a bowl, strain out the blueberry mixture into a fine mesh strainer. Press down the liquid using a wooden spoon. Throw out the leftover pulp. Pour the blueberry mixture in a large pitcher and add the water.  Stir the lemonade with a wooden spoon until well-combined.  Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.  Serve. Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and mint, if desired. Enjoy! Blueberry Strawberry Lemonade Boil the one cup of water and sugar in a pot over medium heat. Mix until the mixture is clear. Shut off the stove and remove the mixture from heat.  Stir in the lemon juice and mix.  Add the cold water and ice into a large pitcher.  Pour in the lemon juice, strawberries, and blueberries.  Chill the lemonade in the fridge until cold.  Serve. Pour the lemonade into serving glasses. Garnish with fresh blueberries and strawberries, if desired. Enjoy!
